messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:17): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Another Mario game for you to not complete!
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:17): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: It's a mario game made by Nintendo. If it wasn't good it would be... surprising

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:18): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: However I should point out that you were way more hopeless than me
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:18): fanboii alert
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:18): toi
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:18): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: On that level, yes. But there are other times when I've been better than you.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Probably. I suck at computer games
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:19): But Mario is teh awesome
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:20): guess i better dust off my wii and connect it again
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:21): which reminds me, I still have that other mario game to finish
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:21): never did anything beyond three levels or so
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:21): the one in the red box
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:22): That's the one I was playing with a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:22): super mario wii or some lameass title
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:22): New Super Mario Brothers Wii
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:22): there you go
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:22): is fanboii with two 'i's a wii fanboi?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:22): i thought that would make sense
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:22): with a single it's Apple :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:23): Yeah, unless one is at the start in which case it is apple
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:25): I wonder if that would be fun over the internet... part of the charm of playing with four people in the same room is cursing each other
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:30): it's better in the same room, but if you've a shared audio channel it's pretty good
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:30): at least with halo

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:53): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, you and the others in Sweden got me addicted to Super Mario. I even went out and rented it when I was back in Aus and had a Wii available.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:54): sadly, I don't have a Wii in Norway, but I wish I did.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:13): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Well, you didn't get addicted enough to buy a Wii then :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:16): I'm serioulsy considering getting one :-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:16): when I can afford it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:16): I know graphics aren't the point with Wii, but what's the fanboi explanation to the lack of digital video output (HDMI mainly)?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:16): but given that I've just moved and have to buy a whole lot of expensive furniture and applicances, it's not a top priority
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:17): seems like the perfect opportunity to squeeze in a fun appliance
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:17): what outputs does it have? Just component video?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:18): yeah, 540p max
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:18): (iirc)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:19): Presumably cost saving or something
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:20): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, wikipedia says 480i, 480p and 576i are supported. 540p would be a very strange video size
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:21): I have a pure consumer electronics relationship with my Wii. I have no more knowledge of, or interest in, the hardware than I do with my food processor
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:21): ah, 576i it is then
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, since the wii came out in 2006, I think that was before HDTV and HDMI was really popular among average consumers.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:24): If they come out with a new HD Wii, then I would expect it to have HDMI
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:25): wasn't aware that HDTV was really popular among average consumers today
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:26): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: the devices are. the content no so much.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:26): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, it's getting more popular. Most new TVs being sold today are flat panels, and I belive most of them have HDMI inputs
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:26): I mean, you can't buy a non-HD TV anymore
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:27): Apparently over half the people who played Gears of War 2 on the 360 don't have HDTV
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:27): are CRT TVs still availalbe anywhere at all?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:27): and I'd expect such people to be more technologically advanced than the average consumer
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:27): (http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/epics-mark-rein-interview?page=3)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:28): I don't have an HDTV yet myself. I might be getting a second hand one soon though
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:35): Gears of War without HDTV would be quite unfortunate

cd4b22ed5d04ebb783a3fd8ab0a39490 (14:37): process question for you w3c process afficianados: <track> element is in whatwg version of spec, but not latest w3c from 23 May http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/ (that I can find). why is that?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:39): accessibility community complained about the proposal being in the specification (specifically the WebSRT format)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:39): the chairs also complained
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): Hixie then proceeded to omit the entire proposal from the W3C copy
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:41): not sure anything has changed, but at least the outcry stopped
cd4b22ed5d04ebb783a3fd8ab0a39490 (14:50): thanks edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
cd4b22ed5d04ebb783a3fd8ab0a39490 (14:51): wouldn't everything be much duller without two parallel-ish specs?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:52): we'd be back to XHTML2

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:59): They're not parallel specs, they're matryoshka specs - you can choose to read a page of the author subset of the W3C subset of the WHATWG's HTML5 subset of WA1
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:59): which is all a subset of what people call HTML5
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:00): cd4b22ed5d04ebb783a3fd8ab0a39490: FWIW, the changes to the outliner are non-trivial, and I'll implement them when I rebase it upon Anolis 2
cd4b22ed5d04ebb783a3fd8ab0a39490 (15:06): thanks snedders

9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:14): Hi I was inserting some text from a HTML Dom nodes innerHTML into websql data store. i wanted to have a rough estimate of the size of the text I am going to insert(In bytes). So i can check against the size of the initilaized data base object... Now how do I know how many bytes each char is roughly occupying in the websql store?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:15): http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/05/28/mozilla_and_opera_want_vp8_in_html5/ -- did I miss the email to the list somehow? :)

9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:17): example doc.firstChild.parentNode.outerHTML.length (doc = document.getElementsByTagName('HTML')) gives me a value of 50815 for a certain webpage... But the size of the doc in chrome debugger resources in 20Kb...
9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:18): Or is there a method in websql to determine how much space is left?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:19): 1) ECMAScript is based on 16-bit code units
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:20): 2) The backend can be in any encoding the browser picks though...

9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:22): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: so the browser may show a different size based on the encoding.. Hmm Now if I am putting the outerHTML into a websql data store how could I know how much space is it actually going to occupy ?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:23): 9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb, you can't, since it's entirely implementation dependent
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:24): 9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb, you don't; compression could be used, etc.

9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:25): Here is the problem... When we do a call   db = openDatabase('documents', '1.0', 'Offline document storage', 5*1024*1024) and then say keep using the webstore.. there seems no way to actually know how much space is a already occupied so web app can increase it some how?
9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:26): as in is there a way to know that?
9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:26): May be some one who worked on websql stuff...
9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:26): could get some magic going here :)
9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:29): i am actually making a scrapbook extension for google chrome exploiting websql..... So from the space usage perspective I need to deal with this issue...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:29): the API is somewhat crappy
9d5e71d4d1fd373540a8fca06dfa5ecb (15:30): There is only a QUOTA_ERR error taht tells me... Kinda hard to base your programming around errors...
